bill_title: to grant and modify the inspection powers of the Board of Nursing and the Board of Medical and Osteopathic Examiners.

bill_versions.bill_text: FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to grant and modify the inspection powers of the Board of Nursing and the Board of Medical and Osteopathic Examiners. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. That chapter 36-9 be amended by adding thereto a NEW SECTION to read as follows: The board, or any of its officers, agents, or employees so authorized, may enter and inspect, during business hours, any place where the services of a registered nurse, a licensed practical nurse, a clinic nurse specialist or a nurse anesthetist are performed, or any place where records concerning these services are maintained, for the purpose of enforcing this chapter and rules adopted pursuant to this chapter. The inspection may include any pertinent books, records, papers, and documents, and the copying thereof. The board, its officers, agents, and employees shall maintain the confidential nature of any records obtained pursuant to this section. The refusal to allow an inspection is a Class 1 misdemeanor. Section 2. That § 36-9A-7 be amended to read as follows: 36-9A-7. In administering the provisions of this chapter, the boards shall have those powers granted them by § 36-4-22.1. The boards, or any of their officers, agents, or employees so authorized, may enter and inspect, during business hours, any place where the services of a nurse practitioner or a nurse midwife are performed, or any place where records concerning those services are maintained, for the purpose of enforcing this chapter and rules adopted pursuant to this chapter. The inspection may include any pertinent books, records, papers, and documents, and the copying thereof. The boards, their officers, agents, and employees shall maintain as confidential any records obtained pursuant to this section. The refusal to allow an inspections a Class 1 misdemeanor.

FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to grant and modify the inspection powers of the Board of Nursing and the Board of Medical and Osteopathic Examiners. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. That chapter 36-9 be amended by adding thereto a NEW SECTION to read as follows: After giving reasonable notice, any of the board's officers, agents, or employees so authorized, may enter and inspect, during business hours, any place where the services of a registered nurse, a licensed practical nurse, a clinical nurse specialist or a nurse anesthetist are performed, or any place where records concerning these services are maintained or may request copies of these records at the board's expense, for the purpose of investigating alleged violations of § 36-9-49, 36-9-49.1, or 36-9-68. The inspection may include any pertinent books, records, papers, and documents, and the copying thereof. The board, its officers, agents, and employees shall maintain the confidential nature of any records obtained pursuant to this section. The refusal to allow an inspection is a Class 1 misdemeanor. Section 2. That § 36-9A-7 be amended to read as follows: 36-9A-7. In administering the provisions of this chapter, the boards shall have those powers granted them by § 36-4-22.1. For the purposes of investigating claimed violations of § 36-9A- 29, 36-9A-30, 36-9A-32, or 36-9A-35, and after giving reasonable notice, any of the boards' officers, agents, or employees so authorized, may enter and inspect, during business hours, any place where the services of a nurse practitioner or a nurse midwife are performed, or any place where records concerning those services are maintained, for the purpose of enforcing this chapter and rules adopted pursuant to this chapter. The inspection may include any pertinent books, records, papers, and documents, and the copying thereof. The boards, their officers, agents, and employees shall maintain as confidential any records obtained pursuant to this section. The refusal to allow an inspection is a Class 1 misdemeanor. FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to grant and modify the inspection powers of the Board of Nursing and the Board of Medical and Osteopathic Examiners. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. That chapter 36-9 be amended by adding thereto a NEW SECTION to read as follows: After giving reasonable notice, any of the board's officers, agents, or employees so authorized, may enter and inspect, during business hours, any place, excluding personal residences not used for commercial nursing purposes, where the services of a registered nurse, a licensed practical nurse, a clinical nurse specialist or a nurse anesthetist who holds an active, inactive, lapsed, or disciplined license are performed, or any place, excluding personal residences not used for commercial nursing purposes, where records concerning these services are maintained or may request copies of these records at the board's expense, for the purpose of investigating alleged violations of § 36-9-49, 36-9-49.1, or 36-9-68. The inspection may include any pertinent books, records, papers, and documents, and the copying thereof. The board, its officers, agents, and employees shall maintain the confidential nature of any records obtained pursuant to this section. The refusal to allow an inspection is a Class 1 misdemeanor. Section 2. That § 36-9A-7 be amended to read as follows: 36-9A-7. In administering the provisions of this chapter, the boards shall have those powers granted them by § 36-4-22.1. For the purposes of investigating claimed violations of § 36-9A- 29, 36-9A-30, 36-9A-32, or 36-9A-35, and after giving reasonable notice, any of the boards' officers, agents, or employees so authorized, may enter and inspect, during business hours, any place, excluding personal residences not used for commercial medical or nursing purposes, where the services of a nurse practitioner or a nurse midwife who holds an active, inactive, lapsed, or disciplined license are performed, or any place, excluding personal residences not used for commercial medical or nursing purposes, where records concerning those services are maintained, for the purpose of enforcing this chapter and rules adopted pursuant to this chapter. The inspection may include any pertinent books, records, papers, and documents, and the copying thereof. The boards, their officers, agents, and employees shall maintain as confidential any records obtained pursuant to this section. The refusal to allow an inspection is a Class 1 misdemeanor.
